intro: Stylosanthes subsericea, commonly known as silky stylo, is a perennial legume native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces cylindrical, seed-containing pods. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often used in forage and soil stabilization. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it valuable in agricultural systems.
